comments:
There are issues in the API and documentation relating to the use of the marker 
extension point "org.eclipse.core.resources.markers", used in conjuction with 
IFile.createMarker().

* If the marker extension is misconfigured through (a) invalid marker 
supertype, or (b) wrong name passed to IFile.createMarker(MARKER_TYPE), the 
primary sympton a developer sees is:

java.lang.NullPointerException	at 
org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.MarkerUtilities$MarkerTypeHierarchy.appendAll
(MarkerUtilities.java:84) at 
org.eclipse.ui.texteditor.MarkerUtilities$MarkerTypeHierarchy.computeSuperTypes
(MarkerUtilities.java:67)

Now, those two mistakes are pretty common and easy to make - a more informative 
error response would greatly assist resolution of the issue. For example, it 
has taken me 6 hours of painstaking debugging and reading to identify the 
underlying config problem.

I am not alone -  a search of the site reveals at least 2 precedents with the 
same sympton and cause:

http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform/msg16086.html
http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform/msg44801.html

* It was not at obvious what the correct value for marker type should be. The 
javadoc for createMarker() says "Marker type ids are the id of an extension 
installed in the org.eclipse.core.resources.markers extension point." Now my 
relevant plugin.xml looks like this:

<extension id="JavacBuilder.javacProblem" ...

so you might reasonably conclude from the above info that MARKER_TYPE should 
be "JavacBuilder.javacProblem". However, only by introspecting a running 
Eclipse instance did I discover that it actually needed to 
be "JavaBuilder.JavacBuilder.javacProblem". 

Probably, it *is* documented somewhere, but I should get some better indication 
of my natural mistake than a NPE in some list append code.

* There is no "Fail-fast" indication of the problem during the call to 
IFile.createMarker(), which succeeds without issue, rather the failure happens 
in another thread, complicating the issue. Perhaps some validation of the 
marker type at creation time is warranted...?

Moving to text, where the NPE is coming from. Bug 43280 in resources requests
error reporting at runtime when invalid marker type definitions are found.
This is already fixed in the 3.2 stream.
